term.title: ampere

item.text: The ampere, symbol A, is the SI unit of electric current. It is defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the elementary charge e to be 1.602 176 634 × 10−19 when expressed in the unit C, which is equal to A s, where the second is defined in terms of ∆νCs.

sources.item: BIPM, The International System of Units, SI Brochure, 9th ed. (2019), p. 132 (https://www.bipm.org/en/publications/si-brochure/)
